decision_conditions: The applicant has not provided any compelling evidence why Clause B should be removed from the S106 Agreement pursuant to Application reference P0743.93 which prevented the freehold of that land subject of that application from being sold or leased separately from the sale or lease of other land subject of that application. The agreement was required to ensure a close connection with occupiers of the main dwelling and annexe building as a result of the circumstances of the site which rendered independent occupation unacceptable through the quality of accommodation and close relationship to occupiers of the main dwelling.  Given that the relevance of the purpose for which the obligation was originally applied has not changed or diminished over the passage of time, the Council refuses this application to remove this obligation.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: Consideration was given to seeking amendments, but given conflict with adopted planning policy, notification of intended refusal and the reason(s) for it was given to the agent in writing 05-05-2023.
description: Application to modify or discharge a planning obligation on a section 106 agreement to remove the requirement that the annexe shall only be occupied by relatives of the main property.
